originalTitle: Ex-Nigeria oil minister stands trial in UK on bribery charges
title: Ex-Nigeria oil minister stands trial in UK on bribery charges
content: Diezani Alison-Madueke took bribes including luxury goods and private jet travel, a prosecutor tells a London court.

originalTitle: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
title: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
content: The African nation argues it is owed payments but Downing Street says it will fight the case.

originalTitle: Nigeria president 'in great shape' after falling at Turkey reception
title: Nigeria president 'in great shape' after falling at Turkey reception
content: On a visit to Ankara, Bola Tinubu was filmed stumbling and falling after walking past soldiers and dignitaries.

originalTitle: Why is Pakistan backing Bangladesh in its T20 World Cup row with India?
title: Why is Pakistan backing Bangladesh in its T20 World Cup row with India?
content: Regional politics at the fore after Bangladesh ousted from the T20 World Cup in India.

originalTitle: Minnesota judge orders ICE chief to appear in court
title: Minnesota judge orders ICE chief to appear in court
content: Judge orders head of ICE to explain agency's handling of bond hearings for immigrants it has detained.

originalTitle: Trump’s JPMorgan Chase lawsuit revives debanking concerns in US
title: Trump’s JPMorgan Chase lawsuit revives debanking concerns in US
content: Workers in 'risky' industries and many religious and ethnic groups have been denied access to financial services.

originalTitle: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
title: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
content: The US federal agency says it will not play an immigration role at February's event in Milan-Cortina.

originalTitle: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
title: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
content: Young Iranians able tell the BBC how they saw friends and other people die as security forces crushed protests earlier this month.

originalTitle: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
title: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
content: The process will be available to foreign nationals without a criminal record who can prove they lived in Spain for five months prior to 31 December 2025.

title: Villa sign striker Abraham for £18.25m
content: England striker Tammy Abraham completes an £18.25m return to Aston Villa from Turkish side Besiktas.

originalTitle: What happens next after latest link between heading and brain disease?
title: What happens next after latest link between heading and brain disease?
content: BBC Sport explores the ramifications of the verdict that heading footballs "likely" contributed to Gordon McQueen's death.

originalTitle: Guardiola apologises to ref Hallam but 'defends' outburst
title: Guardiola apologises to ref Hallam but 'defends' outburst
content: Pep Guardiola has apologised to new Premier League referee Farai Hallam if he "feels offended", having taken issue with the official following Manchester City's victory over Wolves on Saturday. But the Spaniard said he has to "defend my club and my players".
